J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>1. Don't use System.out in your application directly. Your application components should accept a PrintWriter as a parameter somewhere.
>2. In your tests, substitute a PrintWriter wrapping a StringWriter in place of System.out. This is easy to verify.
>

Without providing any code - :) -, I'd suggest you use AspectJ to 
implement solution  (2) without modifying the orignal code.
You would capture all the "System.out.println()" and feed them to a 
StringWriter that you would use in your tests.

If you use IDEA, the eap/under construction version offers - partial - 
AspectJ support.

Alain Ravet
